plugin.name: AndroMDA Application Generator Maven Plugin
plugin.description: A plugin for running AndroMDA's AndroMDApp application generator to generate Maven2 AndroMDA powered applications.

mojo.description: Allows for the {@link ScriptClassGenerator} mojo to be invoked. on one or more given classes.

parameter.name: locations
parameter.description: Defines the java files who's classes will be instrumented.

parameter.name: scriptWrapper
parameter.description: Defines the fully qualified class name of the script wrapper implementation.

mojo.description: Provides the ability to drop database schemas.

parameter.name: executeScripts
parameter.description: Whether or not scripts should be executed (if this is set to false, they will only be generated, but not executed).

parameter.name: jdbcConnectionUrl
parameter.description: The JDBC connection URL.

parameter.name: jdbcDriver
parameter.description: The name of the JDBC driver class.

parameter.name: jdbcDriverJar
parameter.description: The jar containing the JDBC driver.

parameter.name: jdbcPassword
parameter.description: The JDBC password for the database.

parameter.name: jdbcUsername
parameter.description: The JDBC username for the database.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.description: The properties that can be passed to the schema task.

parameter.name: propertyFiles
parameter.description: Any property files that should be loaded into the schema properties.

parameter.name: scripts
parameter.description: Defines the location(s) of any SQL scripts to be executed.

parameter.name: taskType
parameter.description: The type of the create schema task to execute.

parameter.name: tasks
parameter.description: The schema task to execute (create, drop, update, validate)

parameter.name: configurationUri
parameter.description: The URI to an optional AndroMDApp configuration file.

parameter.name: settings
parameter.description: The current user system settings for use in Maven. (allows us to pass the user settings to the AndroMDA configuration).

parameter.name: skip
parameter.description: Set this to 'true' to bypass cartridge tests entirely. Its use is NOT RECOMMENDED, but quite convenient on occasion.

parameter.name: skipProcessing
parameter.description: Whether or not processing should be skipped (this is if you want to completely skip code generation, i.e. if code is already generated and you are creating the site from already generated source code).

parameter.name: skipTests
parameter.description: Set this to 'true' to skip running tests, but still compile them. Its use is NOT RECOMMENDED, but quite convenient on occasion.

parameter.name: testFailureIgnore
parameter.description: Set this to true to ignore a failure during testing. Its use is NOT RECOMMENDED, but quite convenient on occasion.

mojo.description: Provides the deployment of applications to a given directory.

parameter.name: deploy
parameter.description: Indicates whether or not this plugin should perform the deploy.

parameter.name: deployLocation
parameter.description: The location (i.e. path) to deploy.

parameter.name: excludes
parameter.description: Any files to exclude in the deploy.

parameter.name: includes
parameter.description: Any additional files to include in the deploy liked datasource files etc (the files must reside in the project build directory). By default nothing besides the file artifact is deployed.

mojo.description: A Mojo used for executing the build goals from the top level project.

parameter.name: environmentVariablePrefix
parameter.description: The prefix environment variables must have.

parameter.name: executionProperties
parameter.description: Any execution properties.

parameter.name: goals
parameter.description: The default module goals to execute.

parameter.name: modules
parameter.description: A comma separated list of modules to execute in the form: -Dmodules=mda,core,common or if you want to specify the goals to execute as well: -Dmodules=mda:[goal1+goal2+goal3],core:[goal1].

parameter.name: startConsole
parameter.description: If defined starts the build console (i.e. keeps maven loaded and running)

mojo.description: Writes the necessary .classpath and .project files for a new eclipse application.

parameter.name: classpathArtifactTypes
parameter.description: The artifact types which should be included in the generated Eclipse classpath.

parameter.name: classpathMerge
parameter.description: Allows non-generated configuration to be "merged" into the generated .classpath file.

parameter.name: excludePoms
parameter.description: Defines the POMs to exclude when generating the eclipse files.

parameter.name: excludes
parameter.description: Defines the POMs to exclude when generating the eclipse files.

parameter.name: includes
parameter.description: Defines the POMs to include when generating the eclipse files.

parameter.name: repositoryVariableName
parameter.description: The name of the variable that will store the maven repository location.

parameter.name: resolveTransitiveDependencies
parameter.description: Whether or not transitive dependencies shall be included in any resources (i.e. .classpath that are generated by this mojo).

parameter.name: skipProcessing
parameter.description: Whether or not processing should be skipped (this is if you just want to force AndroMDA not to run on your model).

mojo.description: Basically post processes a previously built ear and replaces any war artifacts with symbolic links and then symbolic links the ear to the deploy directory so that we don't have to redeploy an ear in order to make jsp changes.

parameter.name: deployLocation
parameter.description: The location in which to link the exploded ear.

parameter.name: project
parameter.description: The maven project.

parameter.name: rootProjectLimit
parameter.description: The number of levels allowed to travel up before we get to the "root project" (i.e. this will prevent the system from attempting to get parent project that aren't really part of the direct project).

mojo.description: Provides the undeployment of applications from a given directory.

parameter.name: deployLocation
parameter.description: The location (i.e. path) to deploy.

mojo.description:
Display help information on andromdapp-maven-plugin.
Call 
  mvn andromdapp:help -Ddetail=true -Dgoal=<goal-name>
to display parameter details.

parameter.name: detail
parameter.description: If true, display all settable properties for each goal.

parameter.name: goal
parameter.description: The name of the goal for which to show help. If unspecified, all goals will be displayed.

parameter.name: indentSize
parameter.description: The number of spaces per indentation level, should be positive.

parameter.name: lineLength
parameter.description: The maximum length of a display line, should be positive.

mojo.description: Removes the an AndroMDApp generated application structure.

parameter.name: configurationUri
parameter.description: The URI to an optional AndroMDApp configuration file.

parameter.name: settings
parameter.description: The current user system settings for use in Maven. (allows us to pass the user settings to the AndroMDA configuration).

parameter.name: skip
parameter.description: Set this to 'true' to bypass cartridge tests entirely. Its use is NOT RECOMMENDED, but quite convenient on occasion.

parameter.name: skipProcessing
parameter.description: Whether or not processing should be skipped (this is if you want to completely skip code generation, i.e. if code is already generated and you are creating the site from already generated source code).

parameter.name: skipTests
parameter.description: Set this to 'true' to skip running tests, but still compile them. Its use is NOT RECOMMENDED, but quite convenient on occasion.

parameter.name: testFailureIgnore
parameter.description: Set this to true to ignore a failure during testing. Its use is NOT RECOMMENDED, but quite convenient on occasion.
